Description: Tondo and stem sherd of Attic red-figured pottery type A cup; interior: red figure decoration consisting of part of an Amazon (red spiral bracelet; short sleeved short chiton) putting on a greave, bending over to left with right leg raised (two black lines above ankle); exterior: glazed black, with thin reserved grooves at top and bottom of slight moulding at join of bowl and stem; underside: inside of stem black, underside reserved with black central dot, circle and band.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 63, pl. VIII, no. 12)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 510, no. C74)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 237, no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0644) (Phase 1)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School at Athens
